snippet: An ESPNU documentary explores the legacy and the mystery of the 1990 Syracuse lacrosse team, who lost the trophy before it could be returned to the N.C.A.A. after the team’s title was vacated.
abstract: Former Syracuse University lacrosse players Fred Cambria and Brett Jefferson tell story of school's nearly unbeatable 1990 team, NCAA's controversial decision to revoke its national title and mystery of trophy, which has been missing since 1995, in documentary film The Lost Trophy.
lead_paragraph: An ESPNU documentary explores the legacy and the mystery of the 1990 Syracuse lacrosse team, who lost the trophy before it could be returned to the N.C.A.A. after the team’s title was vacated.

headline.main: A Syracuse Lacrosse Team Transformed a Sport, Clung to a Disputed Title and Lost a Trophy
headline.print_headline: They Transformed a Sport, Then Lost Their Trophy
